chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl A. Zierk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daryl A. Zierk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daryl A. Zierk was found guilty of Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May Not have contact with Melyssa Z unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  Obey all orders of divorce court.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in wirting, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION FOR VIOLATIONS.  Huber allowed for work and treatment.

Minutes:  15CF698/15CM965.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Cicchini.  Defense put corrections to the PSI on the record.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $2650.47.  Deft agrees to have the restitution taken out of bond money.  

15CM965 - deft sentenced to 120 days KCJ.  Credit for 32 days.  To commence 5/28/16 by 6pm.  Huber allowed.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Costs to be taken out of bond.  Balance may be returned to poster.

15CF698 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Costs to be taken out of bond.  Balance may be returned to poster.

Firearms which were seized from the deft may be released to whomever designated by the Divorce Court.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

No contact order while in custody filed by State is denied by Court  Bond continued as previously set. / dls

Defendant Daryl A. Zierk appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: KPD Detective E. Traxler sworn in and testified, cross examination by Atty Ward. Atty Krejcarek moves for bind over; Atty Ward objects and moves to dismiss Ct 6; arguments heard, Ct 6 dismissed; on the remaining counts, probable cause found, case bound over to Br 3.  Information not filed, to be filed within the statutory time limits. Motion regarding no contact order to be heard at the next hearing. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
